Posts.Content: Been reading posts from the time I was diagnosed earlier this year, and better for doing so. One month since surgery at MSK. Scored a 4-3 (post op) and progressing on a day to day basis. Next stop, Aug 31st PSA testing.
Posts.Signature: Age:72 PSA PreOp 4.9 Primary Gleason grade:4 Secondary Gleason grade: 3 Total Gleason grade: 7 Surgery: 6-9-16 MSK Surgical Margins: Free of tumor Benign lymph nodes PostOp StageT2a (confined to prostate & capsule, one lobe) 12 week PSA: 0.05
Posts.Title: Hi, New Guy.

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by HighlanderCFH Welcome aboard diceman, Based on your post-op staging and your pre-op PSA, you stand a great chance of having been completely cured. We'll all be waiting for that first post-op PSA. Good luck! Chuck Hi all, Last week had the 12 week follow up at MSK with surgeon on 8/31 and had PSA tested. PSA was 0.05 and was relieved. Doc said to come back in 6 months to continue testing for awhile. Seems both "libido" and "continence' about 70%-80%. Still get sore with a little rectal discomfort when sitting too long or being bounced around in the car. All told, I was blessed to find this cancerous nodule incidentally from hip MRI.

Posts.Content: Thank you all for your welcome, support and good wishes. I'm sure as I continue to recover (seems most pre op info on recovery times may not reflect us older folk) I'll be seeking your respective experiences and insights.
